author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the realm of parchment pure, an alliance draws nigh,
WestRock and Kappa plot, 'neath capitalism's sky.
Their might combined, a dragon's hoard of gold they deal,
In Odin's name, these giants of paper field shall seal.

As tempests brew o'er the ocean of currency exchange,
Bank lords of Europe and the States, their words arrange.
Will new winds fill the sails of EUR/USD might?
Only Frigg knows, on the morrow of Thor's blessed night.

In southern lands where palm trees sway, the keeper of gold stands,
Malaysia's central bank holds tight with steady hands.
Unmoved they stay, as Fenrir's rage in markets twist and turn,
For in their gaze, steady growth and tranquil inflation churn.

feedItems.title: Paper Companies Near Big Merger Deal
feedItems.description: WestRock, Smurfit Kappa are in talks to create a company with combined value of roughly $20 billion.

feedItems.title: EUR/USD in Need of Patience Before Central Banks Spark New Triggers
feedItems.description: Various members from the Fed and the ECB are expected to speak Thursday, but it remains to be seen whether these will generate new inputs for EUR/USD, DZ Bank Research said.

feedItems.title: Malaysia's Central Bank Stands Pat, as Expected
feedItems.description: Malaysia’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged, maintaining that its current monetary policy stance is in line with the country’s inflation and growth outlook.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
From the Eastern dragon's breath, commerce doth wane,
For four moons in line, amiss spreads in the main.
In the realms of commerce, sorrow embarks,
As whispers of gold, this silence stark.

With heralded wings, Airbus soars high,
In August's embrace, their craft fill the sky.
Yet still they strive, with targets unfurled,
To etch their name in the parchment of the world.

The Spanish bond of thirty years' span,
Inflation bound, starts its grand plan.
Yet foresight whispers, firm in its sound,
No overseas bounty in this auction found.

feedItems.title: China's Exports Fall for a Fourth Month
feedItems.description: China’s exports to the rest of the world dropped for a fourth straight month in August.

feedItems.title: Airbus's August Aircraft Deliveries Were Solid
feedItems.description: Airbus delivered enough aircraft to customers in August that its own delivery target for the year is now more within reach, Jefferies said, and deliveries for the rest of the year need to be up 2% for it to reach its 720 target.

feedItems.title: Spain's 2030 Inflation-Linked Bond Shows No Concession Ahead of Auction
feedItems.description: Spain’s 1.00% November 2030 inflation-linked bond, which will be tapped on Thursday, has been trading on the firm side lately, Citi said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Lo, The British Am'rican Bat
Did sell its ventures, and that's that
In lands of Russ and Belarus,
For unseen coins, it shan't discuss.

Good Brother Lowe now doth depart,
The Bank Reserve, he'll no more art.
"Work close," he urgeth with last breath,
Then passeth baton, nigh to death.

Alas! In Germany we find,
The craftsmen's output hath declined.
Of hope we drink a bitter ale,
For weaker grows the salesmen's tale.

feedItems.title: BAT Sells Russian, Belarusian Businesses
feedItems.description: British American Tobacco sold its Russian and Belarusian businesses to a consortium led by members of BAT Russia’s management team for an undisclosed sum.

feedItems.title: Glynn's Take: Lowe Exits RBA Bruised But Still Standing Tall
feedItems.description: Outgoing Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Philip Lowe used his last official speech urging monetary and fiscal policy makers to work together more closely to steer the economy, and defended his seven-year run at the helm.

feedItems.title: German Industrial Production Falls More Than Expected
feedItems.description: Germany’s industrial output declined 0.8% in July, further dampening hopes of a manufacturing rebound in the country as global demand for its goods weakens.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Of China's products, McCarthy rose to distain,
For businesses leaving, the Communists to blame. 
Seek we less dependence, allies and us entrain,
To thwart such power, unchecked, aflame. 

Nestle's reach now extends in a sweet, sugary race,
In Brazilian hands, Grupo CRM finds its space. 
Undisclosed the price, but with swift pace,
Bolsters it the confectionery trace. 

Saudi lands and monarchies round,
Cash flush from the earth's bounty found.  
World's financial stage, their influence bound,
This Middle East, the world's gold mound.

feedItems.title: U.S., Allies Should Reduce Dependence on China, Speaker McCarthy Says
feedItems.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy said China’s Communist Party is to blame for businesses leaving the country and called on the U.S. to work with allies to reduce dependence on Chinese products.

feedItems.title: Nestle to Buy Majority Stake in Grupo CRM
feedItems.description: Nestle said it reached a deal with Advent International to acquire a majority stake in Grupo CRM for an undisclosed sum, in a bid to bolster its confectionery presence in Brazil.

feedItems.title: The Middle East Becomes the World's ATM
feedItems.description: Flush with cash from an energy boom, Saudi Arabia and other Gulf monarchies eager for global influence are having their moment on the world’s financial stage.
